info.description:
The Arrangement Architecture is a Temenos Transact Framework to create and manage  various products such as Loans, Deposits, Accounts, etc. It provides a modular business component-based architecture, whereby users can create their Products by using the components provided by Temenos and these components can be reused across multiple different Products. 

API to create and manage various types of deposits such as Short term, Long term, Call, Bonds and Islamic deposits (Mudaraba and Wakala).
info.title: Deposit Arrangements

post.summary: Create a Short Term Deposit Account
post.description: This can be used to create a short-term deposit and the payload should include customer identifier, customer role,  deposit currency, deposit amount, term, etc.

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

post.summary: Creates a One year Bond/Deposit Account
post.description: This can be used to create a one-year bond and the payload should include customer identifier, customer role,  bond currency, bond amount, etc.

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

post.summary: Create a call deposit Account (No term or period)
post.description: This can be used to create call deposits which have no fixed term or maturity period and the payload should include the customer identifier, customer role,  deposit currency, deposit amount, etc.

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

post.description: This can be used to create term deposits and the payload should include customer identifier, customer role,  deposit currency, deposit amount and the deposit duration term etc.

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId

parameters.name: userRole

post.description: This can be used to redeem deposits and the payload to redeem should include the settlement instructions to which the deposit amount is to be credited. Common usage of this is when customers want to withdraw their deposits before the actual  maturity date of the deposits.

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

post.description: This can be used to simulate a deposit redemption and the payload should include the settlement instructions to which the deposit amount is to be credited. Common usage of this is for simulating withdrawals when customers want to withdraw their deposits before the actual fixed maturity date of the deposits.

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

get.summary: Retrieves the charge amount for a given charge property
get.description: Retrieves the charge amount for a given charge property and its payload includes charge identifier, simulation reference, etc.

parameters.name: arrangementId
parameters.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

parameters.name: chargeProperty
parameters.description: Contains the charge name which is corresponding to the calculated charge amount

parameters.name: simulationReference
parameters.description: Indicates the Reference ID for simulation activity

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

post.description: This can be used to create Islamic wakala  deposits and the payload should include customer identifier, customer role,  deposit currency, deposit amount and the fixed term of the deposit etc.

get.description: Retrieves the basic information of the deposit account including deposit amount, term, maturity days, tax details, charge details, etc. Common usage of this could be to display the basic information of deposits in a Customer user interface.

parameters.name: depositId
parameters.description: Indicates the Id of the deposit account

parameters.name: balanceTypes
parameters.description: Type of balance (e.g. current balance, credit interest accrued, deferred commission, etc.) as defined in the institution's accounting schemas.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

get.summary: Retrieves the redeem bill for the given deposit
get.description: Retrieves the redeem bill for the given deposit by providing the deposit reference and simulation reference for simulated deposits

parameters.name: depositId
parameters.description: Indicates the Id of the deposit account

parameters.name: simulationReference
parameters.description: Indicates the reference id for simulation activity

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from Transact on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

code.description: The code related to override message.

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

partyIds.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

partyId.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

partyRoles.description: Contains the identifier used for the role played by the party or customer in the contract or account

partyRole.description: Contains the identifier used for the role played by the party or customer in the contract or account

agentCustomerIds.description: The id of the 3rd party who sold the product on behalf of the institution.

agentCustomerId.description: The id of the 3rd party who sold the product on behalf of the institution.

agentArrangementIds.description: The id of the arrangement with the 3rd party that has sold the product on behalf of the institution

agentArrangementId.description: The id of the arrangement with the 3rd party that has sold the product on behalf of the institution

agentRoles.description: The role of the 3rd party, select from standard list

agentRole.description: The role of the 3rd party, select from standard list

arrangmentId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

productVariation.description: It defines the type of a customer based on criteria defined by Bank, Eg: Gold Customer, Mobile Banking Customer

pricingSelection.description: If the account has an associated pricing arrangement, the way the pricing is applied is indicated from standard set of values - automatic, manual or No Pricing.

pricingPlan.description: Indicates the Pricing Plan of an account, it gives preferential interest rate/charge schedule based on customer segment

rewardsArrangementId.description: Indicates the Rewards account id assigned to a financial account(Loans,Deposits)

tradeDate.description: Standard date field which records trade date of the account

arrangementEffectiveDate.description: It is a date on/upon which an account is considered to take effect

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

settlement.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

payinSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payoutSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

ddMandateReference.description: Contains the direct debit mandate reference (dd) when the settlement method is set to direct debit. The dd reference is typically the account number followed by a suffix, for example 15245.1

payinAccount.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payinBeneficiary.description: Contains the beneficiary Id used for settlement of the bills due

payinPoProduct.description: Contains the payment order product Id for which the payment is initiated

payinPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payoutAccount.description: The account to which a settlement amount is transferred.

payoutBeneficiary.description: The beneficiary that payment should be made to .

payoutPoProduct.description: Contains the payout payment order product for which payment is initiated

payoutPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the payables

payoutAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

fxSettlementCurrency.description: Contains the currency for which foreign exchange contra settlement account needs to be maintained

fxSettlementAccount.description: Contains the contra settlement accounts used for posting the foreign exchange offset entries

assocSettlement.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

payinSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payinRule.description: Contains the rule on which the system should utilise the funds available in the pay in account during the settlement process. Options are Full, Partial and None

payinSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the bills due

payinRCType.description: Contains the transaction type used by the transaction recycler for retrying the debits

payinRCCondition.description: Contains the transaction recycling rules which define the set of retry conditions

ddMandateReference.description: Contains the direct debit mandate reference (dd) when the settlement method is set to direct debit. The dd reference is typically the account number followed by a suffix, for example 15245.1

payinAccount.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payinBeneficiary.description: Contains the beneficiary Id used for settlement of the bills due

payinPOProduct.description: Contains the payment order product Id for which the payment is initiated

payinPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payinActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to debit the customer account for settlement of the bills due

payoutSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payoutSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the payables

payoutPropertyClass.description: Contains the different payout options, for example charge, interest or principal on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutProperty.description: Contains the different payout options, for example management charge, principal interest or commitment on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutAccount.description: The account to which a settlement amount is transferred.

payoutBeneficiary.description: The beneficiary that payment should be made to .

payoutPOProduct.description: Contains the payout payment order product for which payment is initiated

payoutPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the payables

payoutAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

payoutActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to credit the customer account for settlement of the payables

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

defaultSettlementAccount.description: Default settlement account to be used for all incoming payments and outgoing settlements when a specific settlement account is not provided for each payment type.

changeAmount.description: Indicates the amount by which the original commitment amount increased or decreased.

term.description: Indicates the period to which the BID and OFFER rates apply

revolving.description: Indicates if commitment is revolving or non revolving in nature

updateLimit.description: Flag to define if the limits are to be booked or not at the time of issuing the pre-advice LC. Allowed values: - YES - NO (same as null) - null (default).

aaaId.description: The Identifier of the aa record created

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

alternateId.description: An Alternate Identification for the Deal. This can be used to retrieve the Deal for amendment.

accountType.description: Groups the products based on their type, eg, Checking, Savings, CD etc,.

accountName.description: Display name or short name of the account specified.

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

portfolioId.description: Id of the portfolio or security account

anniversary.description: The start or end period defined in MMDD format to indicate the period when charge rules has to be applied

customerReference.description: The reference which is provided to the beneficiary/ creditor by the originator of payment

payinSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payoutSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

ddMandateReference.description: Contains the direct debit mandate reference (dd) when the settlement method is set to direct debit. The dd reference is typically the account number followed by a suffix, for example 15245.1

payinAccount.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payinBeneficiary.description: Contains the beneficiary Id used for settlement of the bills due

payinPoProduct.description: Contains the payment order product Id for which the payment is initiated

payinPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payoutAccount.description: The account to which a settlement amount is transferred.

payoutBeneficiary.description: The beneficiary that payment should be made to .

payoutPoProduct.description: Contains the payout payment order product for which payment is initiated

payoutPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the payables

payoutAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

fxSettlementCurrency.description: Contains the currency for which foreign exchange contra settlement account needs to be maintained

fxSettlementAccount.description: Contains the contra settlement accounts used for posting the foreign exchange offset entries

assocSettlement.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

payinSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payinRule.description: Contains the rule on which the system should utilise the funds available in the pay in account during the settlement process. Options are Full, Partial and None

payinSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the bills due

payinRCType.description: Contains the transaction type used by the transaction recycler for retrying the debits

payinRCCondition.description: Contains the transaction recycling rules which define the set of retry conditions

ddMandateReference.description: Contains the direct debit mandate reference (dd) when the settlement method is set to direct debit. The dd reference is typically the account number followed by a suffix, for example 15245.1

payinAccount.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payinBeneficiary.description: Contains the beneficiary Id used for settlement of the bills due

payinPOProduct.description: Contains the payment order product Id for which the payment is initiated

payinPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payinActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to debit the customer account for settlement of the bills due

payoutSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payoutSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the payables

payoutPropertyClass.description: Contains the different payout options, for example charge, interest or principal on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutProperty.description: Contains the different payout options, for example management charge, principal interest or commitment on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutAccount.description: The account to which a settlement amount is transferred.

payoutBeneficiary.description: The beneficiary that payment should be made to .

payoutPOProduct.description: Contains the payout payment order product for which payment is initiated

payoutPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the payables

payoutAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

payoutActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to credit the customer account for settlement of the payables

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

defaultSettlementAccount.description: Default settlement account to be used for all incoming payments and outgoing settlements when a specific settlement account is not provided for each payment type.

changeAmount.description: Indicates the amount by which the original commitment amount increased or decreased.

term.description: Indicates the period to which the BID and OFFER rates apply

revolving.description: Indicates if commitment is revolving or non revolving in nature

updateLimit.description: Flag to define if the limits are to be booked or not at the time of issuing the pre-advice LC. Allowed values: - YES - NO (same as null) - null (default).

partyIds.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

partyId.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

partyRoles.description: Contains the identifier used for the role played by the party or customer in the contract or account

partyRole.description: Contains the identifier used for the role played by the party or customer in the contract or account

agentCustomerIds.description: The id of the 3rd party who sold the product on behalf of the institution.

agentCustomerId.description: The id of the 3rd party who sold the product on behalf of the institution.

agentArrangementIds.description: The id of the arrangement with the 3rd party that has sold the product on behalf of the institution

agentArrangementId.description: The id of the arrangement with the 3rd party that has sold the product on behalf of the institution

agentRoles.description: The role of the 3rd party, select from standard list

agentRole.description: The role of the 3rd party, select from standard list

arrangmentId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

productVariation.description: It defines the type of a customer based on criteria defined by Bank, Eg: Gold Customer, Mobile Banking Customer

pricingSelection.description: If the account has an associated pricing arrangement, the way the pricing is applied is indicated from standard set of values - automatic, manual or No Pricing.

pricingPlan.description: Indicates the Pricing Plan of an account, it gives preferential interest rate/charge schedule based on customer segment

rewardsArrangementId.description: Indicates the Rewards account id assigned to a financial account(Loans,Deposits)

tradeDate.description: Standard date field which records trade date of the account

arrangementEffectiveDate.description: It is a date on/upon which an account is considered to take effect

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

alternateIdType.description: Contains the alternate account system identifier used for defining the alternate account Id

alternateId.description: An Alternate Identification for the Deal. This can be used to retrieve the Deal for amendment.

accountType.description: Groups the products based on their type, eg, Checking, Savings, CD etc,.

accountName.description: Display name or short name of the account specified.

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

portfolioId.description: Id of the portfolio or security account

anniversary.description: The start or end period defined in MMDD format to indicate the period when charge rules has to be applied

customerReference.description: The reference which is provided to the beneficiary/ creditor by the originator of payment

payinAccount11.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payinBeneficiary11.description: Contains the beneficiary Id used for settlement of the bills due

payinPercentage11.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinAmount11.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payoutSettlement1.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes

payoutAccount11.description: The account to which a settlement amount is transferred.

payoutBeneficiary11.description: The beneficiary that payment should be made to

payoutPercentage11.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the payable

payoutAmount11.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

paymentType11.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

payinPoProduct11.description: Contains the payment order product Id for which the payment is initiated

payinActivity11.description: Contains the transaction type used to debit the customer account for settlement of the bills due

payinAcDbRule1.description: Indicates the  manner in which system should utilise the funds available in payin account during settlement process

payinSettleActivity1.description: Indicates the activity to be used to settle the dues of the current contract

payinRcType1.description: Contains the transaction type used by the transaction recycler for retrying the debits

payinRcCondition1.description: Contains the transaction recycling rules which define the set of retry conditions

defaultSettlementAccount.description: Default settlement account to be used for all incoming payments and outgoing settlements when a specific settlement account is not provided for each payment type.

updatePendingRetry.description: If this field is set to YES, then whenever user changes the Payin settlement accounts then the modified accounts should affect the pending funding requests raised for the current overdue Bills. If this field is set to NO or blank then the changes to the payin settlement accounts apply to the next due bills

payoutPptyClass11.description: Contains the different payout options, for example charge, interest or principal on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutProperty11.description: Contains the different payout options, for example management charge, principal interest or commitment on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutPoProduct11.description: Contains the payout payment order product for which payment is initiated

payoutActivity11.description: Contains the transaction type used to credit the customer account for settlement of the payables

payoutSettleActivity1.description: Indicates the activity used for payout when payout of funds need to happen automatically

payoutRcType1.description: Indicates the rc type  reference to be used during handoff to inform the recycler what type of transaction is being handed-off

payoutRcCondition1.description: Indicates the rc condition to be used for the payout property to allow variation of different retry conditions

partyIds.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

partyId.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

partyRoles.description: Contains the identifier used for the role played by the party or customer in the contract or account

partyRole.description: Contains the identifier used for the role played by the party or customer in the contract or account

agentCustomerIds.description: The id of the 3rd party who sold the product on behalf of the institution.

agentCustomerId.description: The id of the 3rd party who sold the product on behalf of the institution.

agentArrangementIds.description: The id of the arrangement with the 3rd party that has sold the product on behalf of the institution

agentArrangementId.description: The id of the arrangement with the 3rd party that has sold the product on behalf of the institution

agentRoles.description: The role of the 3rd party, select from standard list

agentRole.description: The role of the 3rd party, select from standard list

arrangmentId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

productVariation.description: It defines the type of a customer based on criteria defined by Bank, Eg: Gold Customer, Mobile Banking Customer

pricingSelection.description: If the account has an associated pricing arrangement, the way the pricing is applied is indicated from standard set of values - automatic, manual or No Pricing.

pricingPlan.description: Indicates the Pricing Plan of an account, it gives preferential interest rate/charge schedule based on customer segment

rewardsArrangementId.description: Indicates the Rewards account id assigned to a financial account(Loans,Deposits)

tradeDate.description: Standard date field which records trade date of the account

arrangementEffectiveDate.description: It is a date on/upon which an account is considered to take effect

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

If this field is set to NO or blank then the changes to the payin settlement accounts apply to the next due bills

payoutPptyClass11.description: Contains the different payout options, for example charge, interest or principal on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutProperty11.description: Contains the different payout options, for example management charge, principal interest or commitment on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutPoProduct11.description: Contains the payout payment order product for which payment is initiated

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

page_size.description: The total number of records per page

page_start.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

total_size.description: The total number of records present

page_token.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

chargeProperty.description: Contains the charge name which is corresponding to the calculated charge amount

simulationReference.description: Indicates the Reference ID for simulation activity

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

code.description: The identifier of the error message
The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message for bad requests

type.description: The identifier of error type: Business

code.description: The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message caused by server

type.description: The identifier of error type: System

chargeTypes.description: Indicates the charge types which are applicable for the transaction. Example: CORRBKCHG

chargeType.description: Indicates the charge types which are applicable for the transaction. Example: CORRBKCHG

taxRates.description: Indicates tax charged to an account

taxRate.description: Indicates tax charged to an account

charges.description: The charges or fees for this transaction

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which a payment is required to be generated

paymentTypeName.description: Indicates Payment type set to an account

propertyName.description: Indicates the Id of the product property

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

chargeSchedulePaymentValue.description: Indicates the payment frequency associated with the charge

dividentPaidYtd.description: Interest accrued for the specified period

lastPaidDivident.description: Deprecated - Interest accrued for the specified period

periodEnding.description: Indicates the end date of the interest period

settlements.description: Indicates settlement conditions associated with the account

payinSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payinAccountId.description: Indicates the Payin Settlement Account. The account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type.

payoutSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payoutAccountId.description: Indicates the Payout Settlement Account. The account into which funds are to be credited against the payment type.

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition

propertyClassId.description: The identifier of a condition that is used to build a product

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

maturityDate.description: Indicates maturity date of the contract

maturesIn.description: Indicates a date or period within which an account gets matured

coolingOffDate.description: Indicates cooling off period for an account until which pre-closure can be triggered without incurring any fees or charges.

term.description: Indicates the period to which the BID and OFFER rates apply

termAmount.description: The monetary amount applied to the account

cancellationPeriod.description: Indicates the Period beyond which a contract is cancelled if it not fully funded in case of deposit or fully disbursed in case of the loan

earlyRedemptionFee.description: Indicates the early redemption fee that is associated during closure before account maturity

withdrawalFee.description: Indicates fee charged for the withdrawals

interestRate.description: Identifies the bid rate of the related currency for the defined time period

accrualAmount.description: Indicates interest accumulated for an account for the defined time period

accruedInterest.description: The amount of interest that has been accrued

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

maturityInDays.description: Indicates the number of days within which an contract gets matured

remainingMaturityInDays.description: Indicates number of days remaining for maturity

commitmentAmount.description: Indicates the total amount which will be lent or deposited for the term

expectedBalance.description: Indicates the amount expected to be deposited by the customer

allowWithdrawal.description: Flag to indicate whether withdrawals are applicable for the account

unspecifiedCredit.description: Indicates an unallocated credit amount to an account

allowDeposit.description: Flag to indicate whether deposit is allowed to an account

allowWithdrawalUnclearedCredit.description: Flag to indicate whether withdrawals are allowed to an unallocated fund available in the account

accountWithBankBIC.description: This is the BIC code of the institution where beneficiary holds an account

pendingDeposit.description: Indicates the sum of debit transaction amounts that are yet to be processed and placed as holds on accounts, but will not be available for use

totalCredits.description: Contains the total number of credits

totalDebits.description: Contains the total number of debits

commitmentBalance.description: Indicates the total amount which will be lent or deposited for the term

lastPaidAmount.description: Indicates the original total paid amount

pendingWithdrawals.description: Contains the total withdrawal amount on hold until payment execution date

propertyName.description: Indicates the  property description to which benefit has been applied

propertyAmount.description: Indicates the payment amount which is corresponding to the product property

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account
